result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case called @ 10:19 AM Defendant Jay Allan Luce in court. Attorney Eric Sheets in court for Jay Allan Luce. Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of potential punishment. Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant. Plea colloquy entertained. Collateral consequences explained. Consequences explained for failure to abide by terms of PPDA. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: Counts 1 - NC. Court accepts plea and stays JOC. Count 2 - Dismissed. Court accepts terms and conditions of PPDA. Matter stayed for 12 months.
Review scheduled for August 24, 2023 at 08:00 am.

Case called @ 12:40 PM Defendant Jay Allan Luce appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Wesley J Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein appeared by video for Jay Allan Luce. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will not be eligible for SPD services if release from custody. Based on the defendant's earnings the Court will expect the defendant to privately retain counsel. Bond argument by ADA Kottke. No objection by Atty Blankschein. Court orders $1500 Sig Bond. NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
